After installing DebKit you need to:
 -su to become a superuser
 -debkit mount the image
 -debkit chroot into the image
 To do this you will need to...

After installing a terminal open the application and type:
 
 shell@localhost$ su
 shell@localhost# debkit mount
 shell@localhost# debkit chroot
 
 !You can mount or enable the automatic mount option in this App so you can skip the second step.
 !Don't forget to:
 shell@localhost# debkit umount
 before uninstalling the App or re-installing the chroot image!
